Speaker: barranca
Dialogue: They're talking about the Curse again!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: We don't need them.

Speaker: barranca
Dialogue: I do not carry supplies.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: We'll leave them. Once we've got it, we'll be able to reach the plane by dusk.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: The Hovitos are near. The poison is still fresh... three days. They're following us, I tell you.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: If they knew we were here, they would have killed us already.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: So this is where Forrestal cashed in.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: A friend of yours?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Competitor. He was good, very good.

Speaker: barranca
Dialogue: No one has ever come out of there alive. Why should we put our faith in you?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: No one ever had what we have... partners.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Assuming that pillar there marks the corner and...

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: I knew nothing! He was crazy! Please!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: What's wrong? Are you lost?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Forrestal.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: We can go no further.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Now, Satipo, we don't want to be discouraged by every little thing.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Let me see that.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Try not to touch the vines.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: Seor, I think we are very close.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: Let us hurry. There is nothing to fear here.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: That's what scares me.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: There's plenty of light, amigo.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: From that hole!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You wait here.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: If you insist, seor.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: No time to argue. Throw me the idol, I throw you the whip.

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: You have no choice! Hurry!

Speaker: satipo
Dialogue: Adios, amigo!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Adios.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Dr. Jones, you choose the wrong friends. This time it will cost you.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: And you thought I'd given up.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Too bad they don't know you like I do, Belloq.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Yes, too bad. You could warn them... if only you spoke Hovitos.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Kill him!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Get it going! Get it going!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: GO!

Speaker: jock
Dialogue: Don't mind him. That's Reggie. Wouldn't hurt a soul.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I can't stand snakes.

Speaker: jock
Dialogue: The world's full of them, you know.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I hate them.

Speaker: jock
Dialogue: Come on now, Sport, show a little of the old backbone.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Do you think the idol will ever show up?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I don't know. Just because Belloq had it doesn't mean he kept it.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Getting it away from those Indians would be a neat trick  I hope they got him.

Speaker: teaching assistant
Dialogue: I couldn't get the McNabe, Professor. Someone's got it checked out 'til next month when classes start.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: That's all right, Phil. Thanks a lot.

Speaker: teaching assistant
Dialogue: Will there be anything else?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: No. I'll see you Thursday.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Hey, if you don't like them, I can always return them.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: No, they're beautiful. The Museum will buy them as usual. No questions asked.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Then what's wrong?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I brought along some people today.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What kind of people?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Government.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Government?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Don't worry, it's not about your business.  They're from the Army.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I've already served.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Army Intelligence. They're looking for Abner.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: But you did study under Professor Ravenwood at the University of Chicago?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: We haven't spoken in ten years. I'm afraid we had a bit of a falling out.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: You know nothing of his whereabouts?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Just rumors. Somewhere in Asia, last I heard.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Maybe Dr. Jones can make sense of it.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: Well... you must understand, Dr. Jones, this is all strictly confidential.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: Yesterday, one of our European sections intercepted a Nazi communiqu from Cairo to Berlin. We don't quite know what to make of it.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: Here it is - "Tanis development proceeding. Acquire headpiece, Staff of Ra, General Tengtu Hok, Shanghai. Locate Abner Ravenwood, U.S."

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Tanis. They must have discovered the lost ruins.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Tanis. Ain't that somethin'!

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Frankly, we're a little suspicious... An American being mentioned so prominently in a secret Nazi cable.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Ah, Ravenwood's no Nazi.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Then what do they want him for?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: They're looking for the headpiece to the Staff of Ra.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: But it says here that's in China.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Only half of it. Ravenwood had the other half.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: What would the Nazis want with this - this Staff of Ra?

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I can tell you that. Over the last two years the Nazis have had teams of archeologists running around the world looking for all kinds of religious artifacts.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: That's right. Hitler's a nut on the subject. Crazy. He's obsessed with the occult.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: What is this Staff of Ra, anyway?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: It all has to do with the Ark of the Covenant.  The chest the Hebrews used to carry around the Ten Commandments.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: An Egyptian pharaoh stole the Ark from Jerusalem and took it back to the city of Tanis. A short time later, Tanis was consumed by the desert in a sandstorm that lasted a year. But before that, the Pharaoh had had the Ark hidden away in a secret chamber called the Well of the Souls. Which is where the Staff of Ra comes in.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Now this was rather clever. The Staff was really just a big stick - oh, I don't know, say like this -  no one really knows for sure. Any way, it was capped by an elaborate headpiece with a carving of the sun at the top. What you had to do was take the Staff to a special map room in Tanis - it had the whole city laid out in miniature on the floor. When you placed the Staff in a certain spot in this room, at a certain time of day, the sun would shine through a hole here in the headpiece and then send a beam of light down here - to the map - giving you the location of the Well of the Souls...

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: ...where the Ark of the Covenant was kept.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Which is probably what the Nazis are after.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: What's this Ark look like?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Look like? Why, it's right here...

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Good God!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Yes. That's what the Hebrews thought.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: What's that supposed to be coming out of there?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Who knows... lightning... fire... the power of God.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: I'm beginning to understand Hitler's interest in this thing.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Oh yes. The Bible tells of it leveling mountains and wasting entire regions. Moses promised that when the Ark was with you, "your enemies will be scattered and your foes fell before you".  An army which carries the Ark before it is invincible.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Oh, there's one other thing that Hitler undoubtably believes about the Ark...  It's said that the Lost Ark will be recovered at the time of the coming of the True Messiah.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: Dr. Jones, you've been very helpful. I hope we can call on you again if we have questions.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Most certainly.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: I've got to talk to you.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: This isn't really a good time.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Indy, it's important.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: All right. Come on in.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I'll be in a minute.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: They want you to go for it. And they'll pay.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Good work, Marcus. I had a feeling this would happen. And, of course, the Museum gets the Ark when we're done.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Okay, here's the way it's gonna be. First, I'll high-tail it to Shanghai and get the piece from General Hok. Then I think I know where I can find Ravenwood. If only I can get -

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: General Hok's a tough customer. They don't call him the Wild Boar for nothing. And he's tied in with the Japanese.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I'll worry about that when the time comes. My only hope is to find the Well of the Souls before the Nazis do.

Speaker: kehoe
Dialogue: Buzz Kehoe, Army Intelligence. You've met Bang Chow.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What's the hurry?

Speaker: kehoe
Dialogue: Some German agents got here two hours ago. Luckily, Bang was able to have them detained at Customs. We'll have to hurry.

Speaker: kehoe
Dialogue: Jesus! Are you all right!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Great. Got it.

Speaker: kehoe
Dialogue: What now?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I've got to get to Nepal.

Speaker: sherpa
Dialogue: Gmoiska! Shurga rintoik!

Speaker: climber
Dialogue: Aye! That'll be your last word.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: That does it! I've been patient with you no-goods long enough. I'm not open at 2 o'clock for myself, you know. It's all for you. And how do you repay me: Trouble and noise and blood on my floor! I won't have it. Everybody out! Out! Out! We're closed. Closed! Do your killing outside! And don't leave any bodies on the porch!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Hey you, deaf one! I said out of my place. I don't mean next Easter, I mean now -

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Hello, Marion.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Nice to see you, too.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Get up and get out.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Take it easy. I'm looking for your father.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Well you're two years too late.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Go home, Mahdlo. I'll see you tomorrow.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Avalanche. Up there. He was digging. What else? He spent his whole life digging. Dragging me all over this rotten earth. For what?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Do you find him?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Hell no. He's buried where he was working. Probably preserved real good, too. In the snow.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Not a bad way to go. Doing what he loved.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Finally the guy that owned the joint went crazy. Snow crazy. They took his away screaming. As they dragged him out, he said the place was all mine for life.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Can you imagine a more evil curse?  So far, it's working.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Why not leave? Go back to the States.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I'll go back. I'll get there. Not that there's a soul there who knows my name or cares. But I'll go. And when I do, they'll know me. 'Cause I'm going to go back in style. With money. A goddamn lady!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Where you gonna get it?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: If I knew that, you think I'd still be running this dive?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I'll tell you something Indy. I've learned to hate you in the last ten years. But somehow, no matter how much I hated you, I always knew that someday you'd come through that door. I never doubted that. Something made is inevitable.  Why are you here... now... tonight?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I need one of the pieces your father collected.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You son-of-a-bitch! You know what you did to me, to my life? This is your handiwork.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I never meant to hurt you.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I was a child!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You knew what you were doing.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I was in love.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I guess that depends on your definition.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: It was wrong. You knew it.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Look, I did what I did. I don't expect you to be happy about it. But maybe we can do each other some good.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Why start now?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Shut up and listen for a second. I want that piece your father had. I've got money.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: How much?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Enough to get you back to the States. Where are his things?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Gone. I sold it all. It was all junk. The junk he wasted his life on.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Everything?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: That's too bad.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You look disappointed. I like that. How's it feel?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What are you drinking?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Seltzer.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Real man's drink. Me, I like scotch. And I like bourbon. And vodka and gin. I'm not much for brandy. I'm off that.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You're a tough broad now, aren't you?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: It's no act, pal. This ain't Schenectady.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I can only say I'm sorry so many times.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You really have money? You don't look rich.  I may be able to locate some of his things. I know who's got them. What do you want?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: A bronze piece, about this size. In the shape of the sun. Probably broken off at the bottom. Has a little hole in it, off-center. Does that sound familiar?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Do you know where it is?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Maybe. How much?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Three thousand. American.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: That'll get me back, but not in style. This doodad must be pretty important.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Maybe.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I knew it would happen eventually. I knew it. Something had to go my way.  I've got to think this out. I'm used to bargaining with yaks.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Okay, five thousand. That's all I can give you now. I can get you more when you land in the States.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You word, huh?  Just like you said you'd be back last time? That was your word too.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I'm back, aren't I?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You can trust me.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Come back tomorrow.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Because I said so, that's why. It's about time I called the shots in this relationship.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Wait a minute. Leave the five thousand here.  You want trust, give some. I want to smell your money.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I trust you.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You're an idiot.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I've heard that.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Hold it. Come here.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Bossy, aren't you?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: That's right. Give me a kiss.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Get out of my place.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Tomorrow.

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Good evening, Fraulein.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: The bar's closed.

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: We are not thirsty.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What do you want?

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: The same thing your friend Dr. Jones wanted. Surely he told you there would be other interested parties.

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Ah, the man is nefarious. I hope for your sake he has not yet acquired it.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Why, are you willing to offer more?

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Almost certainly. Do you still have it?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: No. But I know where it is.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: How 'bout a drink for you and your men?

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: We will stick to the business at hand, Fraulein.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Fine. Why don't you come back tomorrow when Jones is here and we'll have an auction?

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: I'm afraid an auction is not possible.  Why don't you tell us where the piece is right now?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Listen, Herr Mac, I don't know who you're used to dealing with, but no one tells me what to do in my place.

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Americans! You're all alike. Fraulein Ravenwood. I'll show you want I'm used to.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Wait! I can be reasonable -

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: That time is passed.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You don't need that. I'll tell you everything!

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Yes, I know you will.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Shoot them both!

Speaker: second nazi
Dialogue: He's our man!

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: Do as I say!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Unbelievable!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Let's get out of here!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Not without that piece you want!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: It's here?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Forget it! I want you out of here. Now!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Let's go!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You burned down my place!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I owe you plenty!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: You owe me plenty!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You're something!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I am something. And I'll tell you exactly what -

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I'm your partner!

Speaker: fayah
Dialogue: Silence!  Why do you forget yourselves?

Speaker: fayah
Dialogue: What is this? Who brought this animal in?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Why, thank you. I like you too.

Speaker: fayah
Dialogue: Then it shall be welcome in our house.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Oh, no! You don't have to have it around if you don't want it -

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: All of Allah's creatures are welcome here. You please us by letting us please you.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I knew the Germans would hire you, Sallah. They couldn't have an excavation in the desert without the best digger in Egypt.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: All Arabs look alike to them, Indy.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Tell me about the map room at Tanis.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: We found it three days ago. I broke through myself.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Those Nazis are moving awfully fast.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: The Frenchman is helping them.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Belloq. So he got away from the Indians. This is going to be more interesting that I thought.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: I'm afraid this has put the Germans close to finding the Well of the Souls.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Even Belloq won't be able to find it without that. Can you make anything of those markings? They're nothing I'm familiar with.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: Indy... something bothers me.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What is it, my friend?

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: It is the Ark. If it is there, at Tanis... It is not something man was meant to disturb... Death has always surrounded it. It is not of this earth.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Do you really need that monkey?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I'm surprised at you, Indy. Talking that way about our baby. He's got your looks, too.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: And your brains.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Hey! Hey!... where're you going?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: He'll be OK. Come on. Come on.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Run! Get out of here!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Go, dammit! Go!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Indy-y-y-y!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Marion.

Speaker: arab bartender
Dialogue: The gentleman in the corner sent it. He would like you to join him.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Too bad. I'm drinking alone.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Belloq.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Good evening, Dr. Jones.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I ought to kill you right now.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: It was not I who brought the girl into this dirty business.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Sit down, please, before you fall down. We can behave as civilized people. I'm afraid it will be your last opportunity.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Not a very private place for a murder.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Terribly difficult finding a decent vintage here. You were quite vigorous in Shanghai. Unfortunately, our friend the Wild Boar had taken the precaution of making several copies of the piece.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: How odd that is should end this way for us, after so many... stimulating encounters. I almost regret it. Where shall I find a new adversary so close to my own level?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Try the local sewer.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: I know you despise me. We always hate in others that which we most fear in ourselves. And you and I are very much alike.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Now you're getting nasty.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: We have always done the same kind of work. Our methods have not differed as much as you pretend. I am a shadowy reflection of you. But it would have taken only a nudge to make you the same as me, to push you out of the light.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: You know it to be true! How nice. And how ironic the timing.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Do you realize what the Ark is?  It's a transmitter. A radio for talking to God! And now it is within my grasp.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What about your boss, der Fuhrer? I thought he was waiting to take possession.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: When the time is right. When I am finished with it.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I hope your friends are patient. Dangerous work, Belloq.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Yes. Very. You may consider yourself fortunate that your involvement concludes here.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Tell me, did you get away with the idol?

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: I was lucky to get away with my life. The Hovitos proved quite narrow-minded about the whole matter.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You know, if it's God you want to talk to, maybe I can arrange it.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: You have not changed. But, please, do not reach for your weapon until you are ready to die.

Speaker: little son
Dialogue: Uncle Indy, we have been looking for you.

Speaker: little daughter
Dialogue: Come home now, Uncle. Hurry!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Yes. Yes, I'll come now.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Next time, Indiana Jones, it will take more than children to save you.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: I thought we would find you there.  Better than the United States Marines, eh?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Marion's dead.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: Yes, I know. I am sorry.  There is the proof.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: I have much to tell you, Indy.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: And they made the calculation in the map room?

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: This morning. Belloq and the boss German, Shliemann. When they came out of the map room, we were given a new spot in which to dig... out away from the camp.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: The Well of the Souls.

Speaker: amir
Dialogue: Come. Look.

Speaker: amir
Dialogue: This is a warning... not to disturb the Ark of the Covenant.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Just want I need.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: How 'bout the height of the staff? Did Belloq get it off of there?

Speaker: amir
Dialogue: Yes... it is here.

Speaker: amir
Dialogue: It says it is... ten jamirs high...

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: About seventy-five inches.

Speaker: amir
Dialogue: Wait! I am not finished...

Speaker: amir
Dialogue: "And one jamir to honor the Hebrew God whose Ark this is."

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You said their top section was blank. Are you absolutely sure?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Belloq's staff is seven and a half inches short. They're digging in the wrong spot!

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: We have a saying - "A little luck is better than much smartness." Indy, pardner, you are very lucky fellow.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: Bad dates.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: My God! They aren't kidding!

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: There! That is the map room!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What time does the sun hit the map?

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: Just after eight.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: We haven't got much time. Where are the Germans digging for the Well of the Souls?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Okay. Let's go.

Speaker: jeep german
Dialogue: Yes, you. What are you doing there?

Speaker: jeep german
Dialogue: Well bring that rope over here, you cur.

Speaker: hungry german
Dialogue: Now, idiot!

Speaker: hungry german
Dialogue: Water. Bring us water.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Sallah!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Sallah!

Speaker: hungry german
Dialogue: Why aren't you at the digs? Come here!

Speaker: hungry german
Dialogue: No, dummkopf, I said come!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I though you were dead.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: They were throwing me around like a rag doll.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: They must have switched baskets. Thank god for that! Bless those bastards. Have they hurt you?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: No. Not since I got here. They just asked about you - what you knew. The Frenchman's got the hot's for me. I've been playing that along. Oh, Indy, get me out of here.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I have to leave you here for a little while. I know where the Ark is. If I take you out of here they'll start combing the place for us.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Cut me loose!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Keep your voice down.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I said get me out of -

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Look, you don't know how glad I am to see you. And I don't like doing this. But the whole thing will be shot if you don't just sit here quietly. They haven't hurt you in the last twenty-four hours, they aren't going to start now. I'll be back to get you in no time.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: I cautioned you about being premature with that communiqu to Berlin. Archeology is not an exact science. If does not adhere to time schedules.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: The Fuhrer is not a patient man. He demands constant reports and he expects progress. You led me to believe -

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Nothing. I have made no promises. I said only that it looked very favorable. Perhaps the Ark will still be found in an adjoining chamber. Based on the information in our possession, my calculations were correct. Perhaps some bit of evidence still eludes us. Perhaps

Speaker: gobler
Dialogue: Perhaps the girl can help us.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: My feeling exactly. She was in possession of the original piece for years. She may know much.  If properly motivated...

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: I tell you, she knows nothing useful.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: I'm surprised to find you squeamish. That is not your reputation. But it needn't concern you. I have the perfect man for this kind of work.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: The Ark must be in that stone case. What's that gray stuff all over the floor -

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Why snakes? Why did it have to be snakes? Anything else.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: Asps. Very dangerous.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Lots of torches. And oil. I want a landing strip down there.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Believe me, you made a mistake. If you would just give me something to placate them. Some bit of information.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I swear to you, I know nothing more. I have no loyalty to Jones. He's brought me only trouble.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: I cannot control them.

Speaker: belzig
Dialogue: We meet again, Fraulein.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Don't touch it! Never touch it!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Hurry up! Why did it have to be snakes?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What the -

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Why, Dr. Jones, whatever are you doing in such a nasty place?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Why don't you fellows come down here? I'll show you.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: No thank you, my friend.  I think we are all very comfortable up here.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: After all these years, it is most considerate of you to aid me in this way.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: I'm afraid we must be going now, Dr. Jones. Our prize is awaited in Berlin. But I do not wish to leave you down in that awful place...  ...all alone.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Don't put me down!

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: The girl was mine!

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: She is of no use to us. Only our mission for the Fuhrer matters.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: I wonder sometimes, Monsieur, if you have that clearly in mind.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Goodbye, mademoiselle.  Indiana Jones... adieu!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Don't panic. There's plenty of time for that later. Wave that at anything that slithers.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Just watch the floor.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Whatever you're doing, do it faster.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: There!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Stay here!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I'll be back in a minute. We're going through this wall.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Just keep your eyes open and get ready to run. No matter what happens to me.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Indy! Where are you?! Please Lord!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Come on!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: The snakes... are they here?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I guess not. I think I'd be dead.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Do you know where you're going?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Absolutely.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Thank god. Where?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Out.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Don't do that. It scares me.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Look!

Speaker: gobler
Dialogue: Get is gassed immediately! It has an important cargo to take out!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: When the Ark gets loaded, we're already going to be on that plane.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Get out! Get out!

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Stay with the Ark!

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Sabotage!

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: We must get the Ark away from this place immediately!

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Have it put on the truck. We'll fly out of Cairo.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: And Gobler -  I want plenty of protection.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: Holy smoke, my friends! I am so pleased you are not dead.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Us too.

Speaker: sallah
Dialogue: The Ark! They're taking it on a truck to Cairo.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You two get back to Cairo quick and get us transportation to England - a plane, a ship, anything.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What about you?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I'm going to get that truck. I'll meet you at Omar's. Be ready for me.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: How are you going to get that truck?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I don't know. I'm making this up as I go.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: If anything happens to that Ark, we're all dead men ! The Fuhrer will see to it!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I have a feeling I'm not the first woman to travel with these pirates. There's a whole wardrobe in there.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: It's lovely.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: I feel like a virgin bride in this.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: That's what you look like.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: There are some things you can recapture in this life, but that isn't one of them.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What would you like to recapture?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Nothing. That is the way it is.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Did I ever say I was sorry I burned down your tavern?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: No. Then again, I burned up that plane.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: You saved my life.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: And you saved mine.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Seems things have worked out kind of even.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: That's the way I like them.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Maybe we should consider all past accounts closed.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: No. Not yet.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What else?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: The engines have shut down.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: I'm going to find out.

Speaker: messenger pirate
Dialogue: Mister Jones! The Captain he say -

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: katanga
Dialogue: You have most important friends.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Holy shit.

Speaker: katanga
Dialogue: I sent my man for you. You and the girl must disappear. We have a place in the hold. Go, my friend!

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Take it aboard the Wurrfler!

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: And be very careful!

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: What about Jones?

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Not a trace yet, sir!

Speaker: katanga
Dialogue: Jones is dead.

Speaker: katanga
Dialogue: We killed him. He was of no use to us. The girl, however, has certain value where we are headed. She will bring a very good price. If that cargo you have taken was your goal, then go in peace with it. But leave us the girl. It will reduce our loss on this trip.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Savage. You are not in a position to ask for anything. We will take what we wish and then decide whether or not to blow your ship from the water.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: That girl goes with me. It will be part of my compensation. I'm sure the Fuhrer would approve.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: If she fails to please me, you can do with her as you wish.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: What do you think, Captain?

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: ...yet. Let the vermin live. We must be on our way.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Damn!

Speaker: tall captain
Dialogue: The tents have been arranged in accordance with your radioed instructions, sir.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Good. We must take the Ark there now.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: I am uncomfortable with the thought of this -  Jewish ritual. Are you sure it's necessary?

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Let me ask you this - Would you be more comfortable opening the Ark in Berlin - for the Fuhrer - and finding out only then if the sacred pieces of the Covenant are inside? Knowing, only then, whether you have accomplished your mission and obtained the one, true Ark?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Hold it.  One move from anybody and I blow that box back to Moses.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Jones, your persistence surprises even me. You are going to give mercenaries a bad name.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: What about you? Talked to God yet?  Where's the girl?

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Doctor Jones, surely you don't think you can escape from this base.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: That depends on how reasonable we're all willing to be. All I want is the girl. We'll keep possession of the Ark only till we've got safe transport to England. Then it's all yours.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: If we refuse?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Then the Ark and some of us are going up in a big bang. I don't think Hitler would like that a bit. Now I don't want to talk about this anymore. Show me that girl in five seconds or -

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Jones, this is the second time I have seen you looking very foolish.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: It's a bad habit. I'm trying to break it.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: I'll help you. This time I'll kill you myself.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: No! Not in the presence of the Ark! Take him outside.

Speaker: belloq
Dialogue: Indiana Jones, I salute you. I am even a little sorry you will miss this moment.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Thanks. If you talk to Him, tell Him I'm on my way up.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Marion! Marion, can you hear me?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Oh, Indy! Thank god you're here.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Glad I could make it.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Let's get out of here.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: What about the Ark?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Are you game?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Hell yes! We've made it this far.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Okay. Let's do it.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Whatever you do, don't touch it. Let's put it on the floor.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: We'll go down that side. Shoot anyone who looks at us crosseyed.

Speaker: shliemann
Dialogue: Stop them! Kill them!

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Get down!

Speaker: officer
Dialogue: We must cover the drums! Protect them from the bullets!

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Slow it down!

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: You've done your country a great service.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: And we trust you found the settlement satisfactory?

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Quite.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Good, good.  Then I guess that about does it.

Speaker: brody
Dialogue: When can we have the Ark?

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: I thought we answered that. It's someplace very safe -

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: That's a powerful force. Research should be done -

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Oh, it will be, Dr. Jones, I assure you. We have top men working on it right now.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: Top men.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: We may be able to help.

Speaker: eaton
Dialogue: We appreciate that. And we won't hesitate to call on you.

Speaker: musgrove
Dialogue: Thank you all. Thank you again.

Speaker: marion
Dialogue: Well they aren't going to tell you, so why don't you just forget it. I'd think you'd had enough of that damn Ark. Just put your mind on something else.

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: Yeah, like what?

Speaker: indy
Dialogue: It's not the Ark... but it'll have to do.

Speaker: top secret
Dialogue: ARMY INTEL. #9906753 DO NOT OPEN!
